QuestionStatement: If the marginal propensity to consume increase, the equilibrium levels of income and consumption will change in which of the following ways?
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: If private investment of $100 is added to the economy, the equilibrium levels of income and consumption will change in which of the following ways?
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: The real value of the United States dollar is determined by
AnswerChoices: Federal regulations regarding purchasing power
The value of the gold backing the dollar
The goods and services it will buy
The money multiplier
The marginal propensity to consume

QuestionStatement: The demand for money increases when national income increases because
AnswerChoices: Spending on goods and services increases
Interest rates increase
The budget deficit increases
The money supply increase
The public becomes more optimistic about the future

QuestionStatement: An aggregate supply curve may be horizontal over some range because within that range
AnswerChoices: A higher price level leads to higher interest rates, which reduce the money supply and consumer spending
Changes in the aggregate price level do not induce substitution
Output cannot be increased unless prices and interest rates increase
Rigid prices prevent employment from fluctuating
Resources are underemployed and an increase in demand will be satisfied without any pressure on the price level

QuestionStatement: If the Federal Reserve wishes to use monetary policy to reinforce Congress’ fiscal policy, it should
AnswerChoices: Increase the money supply when government spending is increased
Increase the money supply when government spending is decreased
Decrease the money supply when government spending is increased
Increase interest rates when government spending is increased
Decrease interest rates when government spending is decreased

QuestionStatement: Which of the following relationships is illustrated by a short-run Phillips curve?
AnswerChoices: A decrease in the rate of inflation is accompanied by an increase in the rate of economic growth
A decrease in the rate of inflation is accompanied by a decrease in the rate of economic growth
An increase in the rate of inflation is accompanied by a decrease in the rate of economic growth
An increase in the rate of inflation is accompanied by an increase in the rate of unemployment
A decrease in the rate of economic growth is accompanied by a decrease in the rate of unemployment

QuestionStatement: Which of the following could cause simultaneous increases in inflation and unemployment?
AnswerChoices: A decrease in government spending
A decrease in the money supply
A decrease in the velocity of money
An increase in inflationary expectations
An increase in the overall level of productivity

QuestionStatement: If other things are held constant, an increase in the United States imports will
AnswerChoices: Tend to cause the dollar to appreciate because the world supply of dollars will rise
Tend to cause the dollar to appreciate because the world demand for dollars will rise
Have no effect on the exchange rate for the dollar because exports will also increase
Tend to cause the dollar to depreciate because the world supply of dollars will rise
Tend to cause the dollar to depreciate because the world demand for dollars will rise

QuestionStatement: An increase in which of the following is most likely to cause an improvement in the standard of living over time?
AnswerChoices: Size of the population
Size of the labor force
Number of banks
Level of taxation
Productivity of labor

QuestionStatement: The long-run aggregate supply curve is likely to shift to the right when there is
AnswerChoices: An increase in the cost of productive resources
An increase in productivity
An increase in the federal budget deficit
A decrease in the money supply
A decrease in the labor force

QuestionStatement: The consumer price index measures which of the following?
AnswerChoices: The change over time of the weighted prices of a particular group of goods and services
The change over time of the weighted wholesale price index
The change over time of the difference between the gross domestic product deflator and the wholesale price index
Inflation corrected for changes in the real gross domestic product
Inflation corrected for changes in the wholesale price index

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true if the economy is producing at the full-employment level of output?
AnswerChoices: The unemployment rate is zero
No person is receiving unemployment compensation from the government
There is frictional unemployment
The government’s budget is balanced
The balance of trade is in equilibrium

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is a basic tenet of classical economic analysis?
AnswerChoices: Saving is usually greater than investment
The economy is self-correcting to full employment
The economy may be in equilibrium at less than full employment
Inflation is not a serious economic problem
The prices of products tend to be inflexible

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will most likely result from a decrease in government spending?
AnswerChoices: An increase in output
An increase in the price level
An increase in employment
A decrease in aggregate supply
A decrease in aggregate demand

QuestionStatement: Current equilibrium output equals $2,500,000, potential output equals 2,600,000 and the marginal propensity to consume equals 0.75.  Under these conditions, a Keynesian economist is most likely to recommend
AnswerChoices: Decreasing taxes by $25,000
Decreasing taxes by $100,000
Increasing government spending by $25,000
Increasing government spending by $33,333
Increasing government spending by $100,000

QuestionStatement: An inflationary gap could be reduced by
AnswerChoices: An increase in government spending
An increase in the supply of money
An increase in the income tax rate
A decrease in the discount rate
A decrease in the reserve requirement

QuestionStatement: 1.      The circular flow of economic activity between consumers and producers includes which of the following?I.      Households buy factor services from firmsII.      Households sell factor services to firmsIII.      Households buy outputs from firmsIV.      Households sell outputs to firms
AnswerChoices: III only
IV only
I and II only
II and III only
III and IV only

QuestionStatement: Suppose the required reserve ratio is 20 percent and a single bank with no excess reserves receives a $100 deposit from a new customer.  The bank now has excess reserves equal to
Which of the following is most likely to increase if the public decides to increase its holdings of currency?
AnswerChoices: The interest rate
The price level
Disposable personal income
Employment
The reserve requirement
